title: How to find specs for building Native American and Bansuri flutes - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, the Internet is both stuffed with content and at the same time it lacks content.  Basically, there are many websites and tutorials that can help you learn how to build a flute, but rarely a single website has all the information.  Anything related to "how to make bansuri" can be found if you type "how to make a bamboo flute" in Google. There is a great website called PaleoPlanet, where you can find many useful guides, like this one: Bansuri Build-Along in Musical Instruments Forum Musical Instrument Tutorial Section Forum For building Native American Flute, you may visit my website. Crafting Flutes | Flute Craft Tutorial series is a work-in-progress, but it should help you out a bit. As for bansuri, most tutorials suggest the following way to calculate finger holes position. Measure the distance between the middle of the blow hole and the end of the flute. Then calculate % of the distance to place six holes.    Bansuri is a quite low-tone flute so you target a piece of bamboo anywhere between 50-70 cm in width and 20-30 mm in diameter. But I'm more a NAF maker, so: For Native American Flute, I wouldn't rely on actual specs - you need to understand how to make a flute, it's not just about making marks and drilling. Everything matters, from the type of the wood, to the shape of the nest, to the method of tuning. Here - How to Tune Native American Flute - part 2 - I included a table with general measurments (bore size and width), while third part explains a simple method of tuning a NAF. ------- Also, let's not forget about Flutopedia - Crafting Native American Flutes - it has a huge section on crafting Native American Flutes (check top menu "Crafting").
